alert.note: Alert for Alcorn; Benton; Lafayette; Lee; Marshall; Panola; Pontotoc; Prentiss; Tate; Tippah; Tishomingo; Union (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 12:43AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Lafayette, northwestern Pontotoc, Union, Marshall, northern Lee, Tippah, eastern Tate, Benton, southern Tishomingo, Prentiss, southwestern Alcorn and northeastern Panola Counties through 130 AM CDT... At 1242 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles west of Theo to near Barr. Movement was southeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Oxford, Booneville, Senatobia, New Albany, Holly Springs, Ripley, Baldwyn, Wall Doxey State Park, Holly Springs National Forest, Lamar, Guntown, Coldwater, Blue Mountain, Ecru, Jumpertown, Tishomingo, Snow Lake Shores, Cambridge, New Harmony and Bethlehem. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for northeastern and northwestern Mississippi...and west Tennessee.

area.areaDesc: Alcorn; Benton; Lafayette; Lee; Marshall; Panola; Pontotoc; Prentiss; Tate; Tippah; Tishomingo; Union
